rules.natural: If the team is moving downward, then provided that it is not the case that if the weather is clear, the rescue operation is successful, the route is blocked at the cliff.
Either the rescue helicopter is flying or the rescue helicopter is not available.
In the event that the rescue helicopter has low fuel, it follows that the rescue helicopter is not flying.
The team is visible to the helicopter or the team has detected a signal from the beacon.
Should the team detect a signal from the beacon, the rescue operation will be successful.
Provided that medical supplies are available in the kit, if the victim is stable, then the victim is not conscious.
Whenever the team has equipment consisting of ropes, it does not have supplies at the base.
Under the condition that the device is GPS functional, if the rescue operation is not successful, then the path is not terrain navigable.
If the conditions are weather stable, the rescue operation is successful.
The rescuers are team exhausted or the site does not have evacuation complete.
Supposing the team can access the valley, then if the rescue operation is not successful, the team has equipment consisting of ropes.
The team can access the valley or the team can access the ridge.
Provided that the rescuers are team rested, they are not team exhausted.
Either the rescuers are team rested or the rescuers are team refreshed.
In the event that the rescuers are team refreshed, it follows that they are not team exhausted.
Night is falling in the environment or the tools are not equipment damaged.
Given that daylight remains in the environment, night is not falling.
Assuming twilight is present in the environment, night is not falling.
The area has good visibility or the area has poor visibility.
Whenever the area has poor visibility, twilight is present in the environment.
If first aid has been applied to the victim, then a bandage is available as dressing.
Either first aid has been applied to the victim or first aid is needed for the victim.
Should first aid be needed for the victim, then if medical supplies are not available in the kit, the medical supplies are depleted.
Supposing a bandage is available as dressing, a splint is available as a device.
Assuming drugs are medication available, the medical supplies are adequate.
In the event that a stretcher is deployed as equipment, a stretcher is available as equipment.
Provided that manual carry is required for the victim, medical supplies are available in the kit.
Under the condition that the jeep is a rescue vehicle ready, then if it is not the case that a stretcher is deployed or manual carry is required, the operation does not have extraction delayed.
If the jeep is a rescue vehicle stuck, then provided that it is not the case that a stretcher is deployed or manual carry is required, the operation does not have extraction delayed.
Whenever the obstacle is route cleared, an alternative route has been found for the path.
Should the jeep be a vehicle moving, the obstacle is route cleared.
Given that the path is an evacuation route secure, then if it is not the case that the jeep is rescue vehicle ready or rescue vehicle stuck, the jeep is a vehicle moving.
The path is an evacuation route secure or the path is an evacuation route blocked.
In case the path is an evacuation route blocked, then if it is not the case that the jeep is rescue vehicle ready or rescue vehicle stuck, the jeep is a vehicle moving.
If the radio is communication active, the rescue operation is successful.
The radio is communication active or the sky has clear weather.
Supposing the system has satellite link active, the system has weather monitoring active.
Either the system has satellite link active or the system has ground station active.

Under the condition that the system has communication network stable, then if the system has ground station active, provided that it is not the case that if the conditions are not weather stable, they are not weather worsening, the site requires evacuation.
In the event that the team is moving upward, then assuming it is not the case that if the weather is clear, the rescue operation is successful, the route is blocked at the cliff.
Provided that it is not the case that if the team is visible to the helicopter, the rescue operation is successful, the person is a conscious victim.
If it is not the case that team visibility to the helicopter implies operation success, the person is a stable victim.
Should it not be the case that the chart is an accurate map or that if the device is not GPS functional, it is not compass functional, the chart is an outdated map.
Provided that it is not the case that good visibility in the area implies daylight remaining, the operation is search suspended.
If it is not the case that team access to the ridge implies that operation failure leads to having ropes, the tools are equipment damaged.
Assuming that team access to the ridge does not entail that operation failure results in rope equipment, the generator has full power.
Given that it is not the case that splint availability implies medication availability, the victim has treatment complete.
Provided that it is not the case that a stretcher is deployed or manual carry is required, the operation has extraction delayed.
Provided that it is not the case that the jeep is rescue vehicle ready or rescue vehicle stuck, an alternative route is not found for the path.
Assuming that clear weather does not imply operation success, the route is not blocked at the cliff.
If it is not the case that the team is moving upward or downward, the rescue helicopter is available.
Provided that it is not the case that the negation of good visibility implying daylight remaining leads to no search suspension, the operation is search resumed.
Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of stable weather implying not worsening weather leads to evacuation required, the site has evacuation complete.
In case medical supplies are not available in the kit, the kit has medical supplies expired.
Should medical supplies not be available in the kit, the kit does not have medical supplies expired.
If medical supplies are not available in the kit, the medical supplies are not depleted.
Given that the device is not GPS functional, the device is compass functional.
In the event that the conditions are not weather stable, the conditions are weather worsening.
If the rescue operation is not successful, the team has supplies at the base.
Should the rescue operation not be successful, the path is terrain navigable.

(¬(A52 ∨ A53) → ¬A54).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the jeep is rescue vehicle ready or rescue vehicle stuck, an alternative route is not found for the path.

(¬(A7 → G) → A8).natural: In the event that it is not the case that clear weather leads to operation success, the route is blocked at the cliff.

(¬(A9 ∨ A10) → A11).natural: If it is not the case that the team is moving upward or downward, the rescue helicopter is available.

(¬(¬(A36 → A34) → ¬A38) → A39).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the negation of good visibility implying daylight remaining leads to no search suspension, the operation is search resumed.

(¬(¬(¬A25 → ¬A26) → A27) → A28).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of stable weather implying not worsening weather leads to evacuation required, the site has evacuation complete.

(¬(¬A25 → ¬A26) → A27).natural: If it is not the case that stable weather implies not worsening weather, the site requires evacuation.

(¬A18 → A19).natural: In case medical supplies are not available in the kit, the kit has medical supplies expired.

(¬A18 → A40).natural: Provided that medical supplies are not available in the kit, the medical supplies are depleted.

(¬A18 → ¬A19).natural: Should medical supplies not be available in the kit, the kit does not have medical supplies expired.

(¬A18 → ¬A40).natural: If medical supplies are not available in the kit, the medical supplies are not depleted.

(¬A21 → A22).natural: Given that the device is not GPS functional, the device is compass functional.

(¬A21 → ¬A22).natural: Supposing the device is not GPS functional, the device is not compass functional.

(¬A25 → A26).natural: In the event that the conditions are not weather stable, the conditions are weather worsening.

(¬A25 → ¬A26).natural: Provided that the conditions are not weather stable, the conditions are not weather worsening.

(¬G → A2).natural: Under the condition that the rescue operation is not successful, the team has equipment consisting of ropes.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: Assuming the rescue operation is not successful, the team does not have supplies at the base.

(¬G → ¬A20).natural: If the rescue operation is not successful, the path is not terrain navigable.
